text: Bring a large pot of water to boil.'  Sprinkle a pinch of salt into the water as it boils.  Fill up a large bowl halfway with water and ice. Set aside. Wash the kale, and remove the ribs. Cut into a [[Chiffonade| chiffonade]] You can also purchase pre-cut kale at your local grocery store. Drop the cut kale into the boiling water and cook for one minute. The kale should be a bright green color. The kale is cooked for this salad because cooked greens have a sweeter taste and are easier to digest. Use tongs to lift the kale from the water and into the ice bath. Then, set aside. Slice your pomegranate in half. Use your fingers to peel away the white pulp on the inside and release the seeds. Peel over a large bowl to collect the seeds in. Set aside the seeds. Slice the apple into thin strips and sprinkle with lemon juice.  Place your kale into a salad spinner and spin until dry.'  Combine the shallots, honey/agave, mustard, vinegar,  and olive oil in a blender to make the salad dressing. Save a tablespoon of the dressing, and mix the rest into the greens 30 minutes before serving. Sprinkle the pomegranate seeds and apple slices over the top of the salad immediately before serving. Pour the reserved tablespoon on the salad. Finish off this delicious dish with your pecans and Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!
